infoDescription: HoneySens is an open platform to deploy and manage honeypots on a variety of hardware and software architectures.
infoDocumentationDetails: Up-to-date documentation on design goals, architecture, setup procedure and operation.
infoServerNotes290p1: Users can now choose between English (default) and German as frontend language
infoServerNotes280p2: Revision of all API authorization checks
infoServerNotes270p1: Rudimentary system load monitoring to address issues during high utilization
infoServerNotes270p2: Distribution of e-mail notifications in case of high system load
infoServerNotes270p3: Improved performance when retrieving event data
infoServerNotes270p5: Fixed issues related to the renewal of self-signed TLS certificates
infoServerNotes261p1: Added configuration option to limit the number of task worker processes
infoServerNotes260p1: Added sensor configuration download to sensor overview
infoServerNotes260p2: Automatic detection of expired user sessions or loss of connection to the server
infoServerNotes260p3: Revised optional permission restrictions for the Manager role
infoServerNotes260p4: Added group membership info and e-mail addresses to user details
infoServerNotes260p5: Numerous UI bug fixes, specifically for the presentation of tooltips and service labels
infoServerNotes250p1: Unprivileged server containers for secure operation as an orchestrated microservice
infoServerNotes250p2: Removed TLS client authentication for sensors - replaced by HMAC as default
infoServerNotes240p1: Base requirement for updates to later revisions
infoServerNotes240p2: Event archive for the long-term storage of event data
infoServerNotes240p3: Customizable e-mail templates for automatically distributed system messages
infoServerNotes240p4: Event filters can now be activated/deactivated
infoServerNotes240p5: Visualization of new incoming events by means of a counter in the sidebar
infoServerNotes240p6: Extended event list status filter to include frequently required status combinations
infoServerNotes240p7: Added column with group assignment to the event, filter and sensor overviews
infoServerNotes240p8: Integrated status display in services overview
infoServerNotes240p9: The host name sent to the DHCP server is now optional and freely selectable
infoServerNotes240p10: Dialogs revised, e.g. the 'Remove firmware' dialog now lists affected sensors that do not run the global standard firmware
infoServerNotes240p11: E-mail notifications about connection attempt events now include a package overview
infoServerNotes240p12: Password change enforceable at next or first login
infoServerNotes240p13: Added administrative e-mail address as mandatory field for new deployment
infoServerNotes240p14: Process for integrating own TLS certificates revised for compatibility with alternative container runtimes
infoServerNotes240p15: Bugfixes in frontend and backend, specifically in the areas of session handling, caching and server-side validation
infoServerNotes230p1: Server-side sensor status tracking; up/downtime status display adapted accordingly
infoServerNotes230p2: Event notifications extended to include notifications for sensor timeouts and CA certificate expirations
infoServerNotes230p3: Event list supplemented with status filter and counter for new events (per sensor)
infoServerNotes230p4: Added functions for simultaneously editing and removing all events in the event list
infoServerNotes230p5: Optional API activity log for administrators
infoServerNotes230p6: Added description field for whitelist entries
infoServerNotes230p7: Special permissions extended with additional mandatory fields
infoServerNotes230p8: Error corrections in frontend and backend, especially in relation to privileges and event filters
infoServerNotes220p1: Integrated comprehensive fully automated backup system
infoServerNotes220p2: Support for EAPOL/IEEE802.1X authentication for sensors (beta status)
infoServerNotes220p3: Implemented support for automatic event forwarding to external syslog servers
infoServerNotes220p4: Moved event processing to a separate dialog
infoServerNotes220p5: Component division revised: Database, background processes and backups separated
infoServerNotes220p6: Implemented numerous hardening measures within the web application
infoServerNotes210p1: Events can be exported in CSV format
infoServerNotes210p2: Support user authentication via an external LDAP directory service
infoServerNotes210p3: Integrated process management for visualization of user background processes
infoServerNotes210p4: Updated hashing method for user passwords
infoServerNotes210p5: Manual configuration update after system updates is no longer necessary
infoServerNotes210p6: Sidebar can now be permanently collapsed
infoServerNotes210p7: Added options to restrict user roles
infoServerNotes210p8: Standardized behavior of numerous web frontend forms
infoServerNotes200p1: Additional search, filter and sort functions in the event overview
infoServerNotes200p2: Internal network range for honeypot services is now freely definable
infoServerNotes200p4: Status of services is now shown in the sensor overview
infoServerNotes200p5: Short maintenance documentation integrated into the server distribution archive
infoServerNotes200p6: Firmware release notes added to the frontend
infoServerNotes200p7: Countless bug fixes in the frontend and backend
infoServerNotes104p1: Services reconfiguration in the sensor overview can now be locked
infoServerNotes102p1: Added procedure for renewing the certificate infrastructure
infoServerNotes102p2: Mail configuration now allows free determination of the SMTP port to use
infoServerNotes101p1: Conversion of certificates to use SHA-256
infoServerNotes101p2: Observer UI expanded to include event comments and sensor configuration
infoServerNotes101p3: Fixed various display errors in the frontend and several minor bugs
infoServerNotes100p1: Support for orchestration services, countless bug fixes and detail improvements
infoServerNotes090p1: Implementation of multi-platform and multi-service concepts
infoServerNotes025p1: UI module added with general information about the HoneySens project, documentation and changelogs
infoServerNotes024p1: Simultaneous editing and removal of multiple events
infoBBBNotes240: HMAC authentication and custom DHCP hostname support
infoBBBNotes200: Support for event caching, an adjustable service network range, new LED notification modes and USB auditing
infoBBBNotes105: Fixed a bug that prevented service downloads through proxies
infoBBBNotes104: Support for remote server certificate updates
infoBBBNotes103: Support for remote sensor certificate updates
infoBBBNotes102: Static DNS servers are now properly recognized; Local USB dnsmasq disabled to close port 53
infoBBBNotes101: NTLM proxy support via cntlm and disk usage reporting added. Requires server 1.0.0
infoBBBNotes100: Rebuilt image based on Debian 9 for compatibility with HoneySens Server 1.0.x
infoDockerNotes240: HMAC authentication and custom DHCP hostname support
infoDockerNotes200: Fully reworked networking and logging as well as support for event caching, an adjustable service network range and deployment/update with Docker Compose
infoDockerNotes104: Fixed a bug that prevented service download through proxies
infoDockerNotes103: Support for remote server certificate updates
infoDockerNotes102: Support for remote sensor certificate updates
infoDockerNotes101: TLM proxy support via cntlm and disk usage reporting added. Requires server 1.0.x
